title: Nitin Gadkari urges automobile industry to promote ethanol, flex fuels
content: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari urged representatives from the Society of Indian Automobile Manufacturers (SIAM) to explore promoting ethanol and flex fuels in India. During a meeting, the discussion highlighted Brazil's success with flex fuels and how a shift to biofuels can reduce pollution and fossil fuel imports while supporting farmers.
summary: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari urged representatives from the Society of Indian Automobile Manufacturers (SIAM) to explore promoting ethanol and flex fuels in India. During a meeting, the discussion highlighted Brazil's success with flex fuels and how a shift to biofuels can reduce pollution and fossil fuel imports while supporting farmers.

title: Droom marks 10 years with the launch of AI-powered platform
content: Founded in 2014, Droom has evolved from a start-up to a platform that has supported over 2.5 million customers. Over the past decade, the company has sold more than 580,000 vehicles valued at USD 7.3 billion and facilitated 4.5 million listings. Droom’s network includes 23,000 dealers across 1,176 cities, and it currently attracts 16 million monthly active users with 16.2 million app downloads, the company said in a media release.
summary: Founded in 2014, Droom has evolved from a start-up to a platform that has supported over 2.5 million customers. Over the past decade, the company has sold more than 580,000 vehicles valued at USD 7.3 billion and facilitated 4.5 million listings. Droom’s network includes 23,000 dealers across 1,176 cities, and it currently attracts 16 million monthly active users with 16.2 million app downloads, the company said in a media release.

title: TomTom sees location tech sales at low end of guidance as weak auto demand weighs
content: A slowdown in global auto demand has impacted TomTom, which makes a bulk of its sales from location technology applications for cars. In July, it suspended its 2025 targets and trimmed its revenue expectations for 2024 because of this.
summary: A slowdown in global auto demand has impacted TomTom, which makes a bulk of its sales from location technology applications for cars. In July, it suspended its 2025 targets and trimmed its revenue expectations for 2024 because of this.

title: ‘The Indian tech hub will have global products and deliver global services’
content: In the following interview, BMW Group’s CIO and Sr. VP Alexander Buresch, and Christoph Grote, Sr. VP – Software and E/E architecture, talk to ETAuto’s Editor - Technology Sumantra Bibhuti Barooah about how BMW plans to tap India for technology leadership, the trends of automobile softwarisation, Autonomous Driving,and whether BMW could see its future SDV programmes being developed in India.
summary: In the following interview, BMW Group’s CIO and Sr. VP Alexander Buresch, and Christoph Grote, Sr. VP – Software and E/E architecture, talk to ETAuto’s Editor - Technology Sumantra Bibhuti Barooah about how BMW plans to tap India for technology leadership, the trends of automobile softwarisation, Autonomous Driving,and whether BMW could see its future SDV programmes being developed in India.

title: Tata Elxsi beats Q2 profit estimates driven by transportation segment
content: ​​Analysts had expected 2.05 billion rupees, according to data from LSEG. Revenue from operations rose 8.3% to 9.55 billion rupees, in line with analysts' estimate of 9.56 billion rupees.
summary: ​​Analysts had expected 2.05 billion rupees, according to data from LSEG. Revenue from operations rose 8.3% to 9.55 billion rupees, in line with analysts' estimate of 9.56 billion rupees.

title: Tesla gambles on 'black box' AI tech for robotaxis
content: Convincing regulators and passengers of the vehicle's safety could prove much harder and take much longer - while its main competitors, such as Alphabet's Waymo, expand robotaxi fleets they're already operating in select cities today.
summary: Convincing regulators and passengers of the vehicle's safety could prove much harder and take much longer - while its main competitors, such as Alphabet's Waymo, expand robotaxi fleets they're already operating in select cities today.

title: Maruti Suzuki enhances road safety with automation of 12 driving license test tracks in Uttar Pradesh
content: Maruti Suzuki India Limited has agreed with Uttar Pradesh's Transport Department to automate 12 more driving license test tracks. The automation aims to make the issuance process more scientific, transparent, and efficient, enhancing road safety. Earlier, five tracks were automated successfully. High-definition cameras and an integrated IT system will evaluate applicants comprehensively.
summary: Maruti Suzuki India Limited has agreed with Uttar Pradesh's Transport Department to automate 12 more driving license test tracks. The automation aims to make the issuance process more scientific, transparent, and efficient, enhancing road safety. Earlier, five tracks were automated successfully. High-definition cameras and an integrated IT system will evaluate applicants comprehensively.

title: Readywire equips automotive dealerships with AI-driven ERP solutions for peak season surge
content: Many automotive dealerships face challenges because of manual processes and disconnected systems during peak periods, which can lead to missed inquiries, longer wait times for test drives, and errors in promotional offers, resulting in lost sales and customer dissatisfaction.
summary: Many automotive dealerships face challenges because of manual processes and disconnected systems during peak periods, which can lead to missed inquiries, longer wait times for test drives, and errors in promotional offers, resulting in lost sales and customer dissatisfaction.

title: Foxconn building Nvidia superchip facility in Mexico, say executives
content: ​​Foxconn, the world's largest contract electronics manufacturer and known as Apple's biggest iPhone assembler, has been benefiting from the artificial intelligence boom as it assembles servers used to process AI work. "We're building the largest GB200 production facility on the planet," said Benjamin Ting, Foxconn senior vice president for the cloud enterprise solutions business group.
summary: ​​Foxconn, the world's largest contract electronics manufacturer and known as Apple's biggest iPhone assembler, has been benefiting from the artificial intelligence boom as it assembles servers used to process AI work. "We're building the largest GB200 production facility on the planet," said Benjamin Ting, Foxconn senior vice president for the cloud enterprise solutions business group.

title: Uber to launch AI assistant powered by OpenAI's GPT-4o to help drivers go electric
content: The ride-hailing company has advocated a shift to EVs for several years and has pledged $800 million to support its driver partners' switching entirely to EVs by 2040.
summary: The ride-hailing company has advocated a shift to EVs for several years and has pledged $800 million to support its driver partners' switching entirely to EVs by 2040.

title: Tata Tech & BMW Group launch BMW TechWorks India JV to drive automotive innovation; operations to start in Nov
content: Tata Technologies and BMW Group have launched BMW TechWorks India, a joint venture aimed at innovation in automotive technology and business IT. The venture, starting with 100 employees, will rapidly scale to a four-digit workforce by 2025, focusing on India’s top engineering talent. It aims to develop next-gen software solutions for vehicles.
summary: Tata Technologies and BMW Group have launched BMW TechWorks India, a joint venture aimed at innovation in automotive technology and business IT. The venture, starting with 100 employees, will rapidly scale to a four-digit workforce by 2025, focusing on India’s top engineering talent. It aims to develop next-gen software solutions for vehicles.

title: Flextron launches rapid charging technology FlexStack for 2Ws
content: Flextron has launched FlexStack, an innovative rapid-charging technology for electric two-wheelers made in India. It allows EVs to charge 80% in just 10 minutes with Battery-As-A-Service. The system is scalable, easy to integrate, and uses advanced liquid cooling technology. The company plans to deploy 100 FlexGrid chargers in the next 90 days.
summary: Flextron has launched FlexStack, an innovative rapid-charging technology for electric two-wheelers made in India. It allows EVs to charge 80% in just 10 minutes with Battery-As-A-Service. The system is scalable, easy to integrate, and uses advanced liquid cooling technology. The company plans to deploy 100 FlexGrid chargers in the next 90 days.

title: Japan's Nissan to invest in auto tech firm ChargeScape
content: ChargeScape, which provides software and technology to optimize EV battery charging, competes in a tight market that is dominated by Tesla and has seen newer entrants such as ChargePoint, Gridserve and BP Pulse.
summary: ChargeScape, which provides software and technology to optimize EV battery charging, competes in a tight market that is dominated by Tesla and has seen newer entrants such as ChargePoint, Gridserve and BP Pulse.

title: Inaugural Autonomous BAJA SAEINDIA 2024 showcases India’s future in autonomous mobility
content: Autonomous BAJA SAEINDIA 2024 concluded at ARAI, Pune. Five engineering college teams competed in ADAS and autonomous vehicle technology. The Remote Driving System event highlighted precision and technical skills. Team IPS-Sprinter's from Indore won overall. Registrations for the 2025 edition will open in October 2024. The event showcased India's future in autonomous mobility.
summary: Autonomous BAJA SAEINDIA 2024 concluded at ARAI, Pune. Five engineering college teams competed in ADAS and autonomous vehicle technology. The Remote Driving System event highlighted precision and technical skills. Team IPS-Sprinter's from Indore won overall. Registrations for the 2025 edition will open in October 2024. The event showcased India's future in autonomous mobility.

title: Uber, Lyft drivers use Teslas as makeshift robotaxis, raising safety concerns
content: A self-driving Tesla used for Uber collided with an SUV in Las Vegas, causing worries about the safety of autonomous ride-hailing services. Federal and state authorities say drivers are responsible for their vehicles, even when using driver-assist software like Tesla's Full Self-Driving. Tesla is planning to expand its autonomous vehicle network.
summary: A self-driving Tesla used for Uber collided with an SUV in Las Vegas, causing worries about the safety of autonomous ride-hailing services. Federal and state authorities say drivers are responsible for their vehicles, even when using driver-assist software like Tesla's Full Self-Driving. Tesla is planning to expand its autonomous vehicle network.

title: JK Tyre partners with Vertelo to launch 'Connected Mobility Solutions' for EV fleets with real-time tyre monitoring
content: JK Tyre & Industries partners with Vertelo to provide connected mobility solutions for electric vehicle fleets in India using their new generation EV tyres with Treel sensors. These tech-enabled solutions will enhance fleet efficiency and performance. Services start from Mumbai with a dedicated team for round-the-clock support.
summary: JK Tyre & Industries partners with Vertelo to provide connected mobility solutions for electric vehicle fleets in India using their new generation EV tyres with Treel sensors. These tech-enabled solutions will enhance fleet efficiency and performance. Services start from Mumbai with a dedicated team for round-the-clock support.

title: Exclusive: Reliance Industries appoints former Mahindra Electric VP Ashish Tarte as CTO- New Mobility
content: Tarte’s mandate is to oversee technological advancements, with a key focus on driving cutting-edge innovations in areas such as Mobility As A Service (MaaS), Battery As A Service (BaaS) , Hydrogen Engines (H2ICE), and other related areas for Reliance New Mobility’s Bengaluru division. These will be critical for sustainable mobility solutions in India, which Reliance plans to offer.
summary: Tarte’s mandate is to oversee technological advancements, with a key focus on driving cutting-edge innovations in areas such as Mobility As A Service (MaaS), Battery As A Service (BaaS) , Hydrogen Engines (H2ICE), and other related areas for Reliance New Mobility’s Bengaluru division. These will be critical for sustainable mobility solutions in India, which Reliance plans to offer.

title: Nio partners with Monolith for real-time AI EV battery testing
content: Monolith already works with around 10 of the world's top 20 automakers test electric vehicle batteries using machine learning algorithms, including Mercedes-Benz, BMW and Honda, to speed up their development and help western automakers catch up with newer Chinese rivals.
summary: Monolith already works with around 10 of the world's top 20 automakers test electric vehicle batteries using machine learning algorithms, including Mercedes-Benz, BMW and Honda, to speed up their development and help western automakers catch up with newer Chinese rivals.

title: Autonomous BAJA SAEINDIA to be organised at ARAI from Oct 4-6 in Pune
content: The competition was officially inaugurated at a press conference at ADYPU on September 30, 2024. This season's aBAJA has garnered support from 40 diverse partners in industry and academia, including Automotive Test Systems, Daimler Truck Innovation Center India, and the Technology Innovation Hub on Autonomous Navigation Systems at IIT Hyderabad. Major organisations like SAE International, SIAM, and AICTE are also backing the event. Registrations for aBAJA 2025 will open on October 6, 2024, with SAEINDIA seeking further support from additional organizations.
summary: The competition was officially inaugurated at a press conference at ADYPU on September 30, 2024. This season's aBAJA has garnered support from 40 diverse partners in industry and academia, including Automotive Test Systems, Daimler Truck Innovation Center India, and the Technology Innovation Hub on Autonomous Navigation Systems at IIT Hyderabad. Major organisations like SAE International, SIAM, and AICTE are also backing the event. Registrations for aBAJA 2025 will open on October 6, 2024, with SAEINDIA seeking further support from additional organizations.

title: US lawmakers ask Mexican president-elect to address Chinese vehicle concerns
content: All modern cars and trucks have onboard network hardware providing internet access that allows them to share data with devices both inside and outside the vehicle.
summary: All modern cars and trucks have onboard network hardware providing internet access that allows them to share data with devices both inside and outside the vehicle.
